name: places/ChIJk0WyBib2wokRQaI3qJPFhG0
formattedAddress: 250 W 100th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 250 W 100th St, New York, NY 10025-5325, USA

originalText.text: I used to go there quite often until they raised the prices without improving their value. The basement is cramped with pillars in the way and the good tables upstairs are often occupied by their in-group depending on the time of day. Interestingly, they raised the cost of membership right after opening up a new place in New Jersey. Were they trying to offset those costs? Perhaps. Either way, not cool.

originalText.text:
Okay place for table tennis. I was at the place on Sunday around 7.45 pm but didn’t find any players to hit with.
The place is small and enough room between the tables.

The place is small and enough room between the tables.

originalText.text: If your passionate about the game, then this is a great place to play table tennis with friends. From March 2021 till now, I have played here for many weekends and absolutely love their service and courteous staff. Lots of room to play upstairs and downstairs. Highly recommended.

text.text: If your passionate about the game, then this is a great place to play table tennis with friends. From March 2021 till now, I have played here for many weekends and absolutely love their service and courteous staff. Lots of room to play upstairs and downstairs. Highly recommended.

originalText.text: On a recent family visit to New York, my 10-year-old son had two private lessons with Andriana. She is a superb instructor and has set him on the right course with persistent and expert guidance and a focus on proper technique. There was no babying or sugarcoating. Only the necessary encouragement to work hard and improve.

text.text: On a recent family visit to New York, my 10-year-old son had two private lessons with Andriana. Only the necessary encouragement to work hard and improve.

originalText.text: Try to encourage my 8 years old son to play table tennis. MY brother in law recommended this place because his daughter took lessons here before. After I paid the table for 1 hour and started to play only 10 minutes. Two guys came to us and asked us to leave and use table downstairs in the basement instead. Because the AC is cooler and they need more space to play. I refused them. I don’t need AC and need more space too!! They asked  “Are you a member? “because they are. They have right to play any table they want! So what? I came first and paid for it. They said that is fine if I am not leaving, they will share and play on our table with my little 8 years old son! How horrible they are. Won’t come back again.  DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. BE AWARE!!!
